values: Okay you guys, this is the second reminder to add me as because I WILL NOT be using this journal anymore.
I will be <lj user=nightglow> from now on.  Please add me if you haven't already.  :)

I got home today and just crashed.  Well, I ate first, but then I slept for two solid hours.  And I still feel exhausted right now ... I finally finished my European history homework (I'm having a late streak in that class).  I still have to do PreCalc.  And my headache is returning... great.  I am so groggy.  I wish I could go to sleep.

I'm taking a break from my mountain of homework.  I know I haven't been updating that much anymore.  It's probably because I have nothing to say.  Meh.

<lj-cut text="Incoherent ramblings."><lj-cut>I've been thinking a lot lately about ... stuff.  Lots of random things that I shouldn't be thinking about or I don't want myself to think about.  It seems like whenever you don't want yourself to think about something, you usually wind up thinking about it anyway, and all the time for that matter.  It's a pretty hopeless situation.  I was listening to Plumb while doing my PreCalc, and it sorta put me in a melancholy mood.  Especially "Damaged" ... I feel damaged most of the time.  I feel like I'm not the way I supposed to be, whatever that means.  Damaged as in missing something?  Maybe.  Missing... what?  Solace I guess.  Perhaps not so much with myself, but with others around me.

I find myself attracted to people who are in no way like me.  Maybe because I feel that they have something I don't, and whatever that is, I need it.  Or not.  Or maybe it's that rebellious streak, disregarding authority, wanting something just because I know it's "bad" and I can't have it.  "Having is not so pleasing a thing as wanting; it is illogical but often true."  I agree.</lj-cut>

Truth is what it is.  It will always be, no matter what you think or what you do.  You cannot warp it, you cannot twist it to what you feel it should be.  There are absolute standards, whether you like it or not.  And no matter how much you try to reason with yourself, trying to convince yourself that your selfish little ideas are acceptable, you are just digging a deeper hole.  And someday you're going to be in a darkness so thick, so blinding, you won't be able to discern where you went wrong.  But I pray to God it won't be too late.

I'm not sure about "beautiful" and "attractive" but everything else is absolutely correct. Wow. Beautiful but full of melancholy attractive very empathic loves anything beautiful and tasteful loves to travel dreamer restless capricious honest can be influenced but is not easy to live with demanding good intuition suffers in love but finds sometimes an anchoring partner. [from here]
It's 6:09AM and already 66 degrees.  It's September. Where is the cool/cold weather?  *taps foot* I don't see it.

I know I haven't posted on what I thought of school, so I guess I'll do it now while I have some free time.  I'm stealing your format, Land.

AP European History (Hour 1, Fleet):  This has got to be my favorite area of history.  The class mainly consists of seniors, so I feel like I'm on an equal footing with everyone.  Well, everyone except for Max who is some kind of a genius freak.  But this class is definitely a good way to start my morning.

PreCalc (Hour 2, Cornell):  The only word I can think of to describe this class is "meh".  I've never liked math.  So far the work isn't that hard, and I hope I'll be able to understand everything we cover this year.

AP U.S. History (Hour 3, Fons):  As just about everyone else has already said, Fons is insane.  The man is radically liberal and rants about many things.  And participation is one-third of our grade so right now I don't like this class too much.  If there's anything I have a mortal fear of, it's public speaking and giant insects/arachnids.  

Lunch (Hour 4):  Crowded, crowded, crowded.  There are too many annoying freshmen.  The only good thing is that I have it with a good amount of my friends.

Pre-AP English 11 Honors (Hour 5-6, White):  I really like this class.  Mr. White is very laid back and an all-around cool guy.  We'll be studying The Crucible, The Great Gatsby, and many other awesome books this year, so I'm satisfied.

Intro to Greek Life & Lit (12:30 - 1:45 MW at UWM, D. Mulroy) - We're reading The Iliad by Homer right now, and after that we read The Odyssey.  My professor seems like a nice guy and he's not too boring when giving a lecture.  This girl that sat next to me started talking to me and she seems nice.  There's also a guy with dreads ... I'll have plenty to look at this semester.  Heh.
Hey, can any of you guys explain to me exactly what we're supposed to write for that Titanic paper in U.S. History?  He didn't explain it all that well.

I went and saw The Matrix Reloaded this afternoon with my brother. One word: wow. The only parts I didn't too much care for were Morpheus's speech at Zion (he sounded like cardboard) and the sex scene. It's like...okay already, we know Neo and Trinity are in love. They could have at least done a fade-out or something. But otherwise, I loved it. The freeway chase was awesome. School starts tomorrow. And I feel nothing.
I'm back to my black/gray/white color scheme.  I got tired of the earthy thing I was going for in the previous scheme ... I just wasn't satisfied with something about it.  Meh.

I'm back from Beaver Dam and wondering, as always, where the week went.  I have two more days before school begins... geesh, I remember when it was two months.  I got my UWM ID in the mail while I was gone.  I swear I look stoned.  Maybe I can get a new photo taken sometime.  I went to Madison on Monday and was able to get a new hemp necklace at a store on State Street (Sunshine Daydreams).  It still smells like incense.  And I got a lot of cheap books at various places.  I know I have too many, but I like them all.  I need to get a new book case for my room, that's for sure.

And right now I'm feeling very hungry but I can't find anything I want to eat.  I hate when that happens.

I finally bought some shoes today at Pacific Sunwear. It seems like good female skateboard shoes are becoming few and far between. I also found The Robber Bride by Margaret Atwood today at Half-Price Books for $0.95. Dee and Tessa (one of my co-workers) say she's a great author. I'm looking forward to reading it. Tomorrow is my UWM orientation. I get my ID picture taken, my U-Pass, my books, and a little tour (courtesy my parents). My grandparents are supposed to come in the early afternoon to take me to Beaver Dam for a week. It will definitely be good to see them. It always is. I heard Dido is coming out with a new CD on September 30. I heard "White Flag" the other day and I loved it, so I'm looking forward to buying the album. Geesh, it's been about four years since her last one came out. Excellent stuff.
Today my journal is two years old.  Happy birthday, lovely journal.

<u>SEMESTER ONE</u>

Hour 1-1 AP European History (Fleet)
Hour 2-2 PreCalc Honors 12 (Cornell)
Hour 3-3 AP U.S. History 11 (Fons)
Hour 4-4 Lunch
Hour 5-6 Pre-AP English 11 Honors (White)
Hour 7-8 UWM
Hour 9-9 UWM
Hour 10-10 Learning Center (Grewal; Crisostomo said I could skip it)
Hour 11-11 Career/College (Jutrzonka; the so-called "special" homeroom)
There's a God-shaped hole in all of us And the restless soul is searching There's a God-shaped hole in all of us And it's a void only He can fill

Rednecks

Design your own hell

Two weeks from right now I will be in school again.  That thought alone is enough to ruin the rest of the day.  

Julie called me yesterday and said Sheridan might open again just for tomorrow.  I'm guessing this is because of the high temperatures and the dissatisfaction of the neighborhood at closing early.  She said she's know for sure today.  So...I may be working tomorrow.  Hopefully I can go on vacation to my grandparents' house this week.  I feel weird without a summer visit.

I hate it when people don't tell me things.  Even things that I know are none of my business.  If I ask someone about something and they say "I can't tell you" or "I won't tell you" I just take it personally.  I don't know why.  That's the way I've always been.

Take the test, by Emily.

Take the test, by Emily.

I Would Not Survive The Metro.
Would you?


How Drunk Are You?

From age: 16 years, 5 months, 7 days reason for livejournal username: I created it alomost two years ago. I love the band Skillet, but I'm not sure why I added 'rusty'. aim/msn/irc/other chat screename: DeadEndMoon reason for aim/msn/irc/other chat screename: It's a song by Kevin Max that I really like...and the name just sounded nifty. why do you enjoy reading my livejournal?: It's very interesting...and also the fact that you like Lacuna Coil. ;) interesting fact about you: I was locked in an antique store a few years ago. weird fact about you: Umm...I can do the Mr. Spock eyebrow. quote: "I hate stupid people... They should wear signs that say 'I'm stupid' so you'd know better than to talk to them... You'd walk up to them saying 'Hey, could you help me wi- oop, sorry, didn't see your sign.'" [Greonhal, The Viking Masseure (now 18)] name a website worth visiting: Psycho-ward. Haha. will you post this in your livejournal?: Sure. if you saw me in the street, would you say hello?: Of course I would. :)

Gotta peel away the skin Just to find the truth in here... Since attendance has been down some thirty percent this summer, Milwaukee County will be closing around six of their pools on August 17th. I know Matt was talking about us possibly closing on that day. I would like the extra vacation time before school starts, but I could definitely use the money for working those days. Hrm. I hate clothes shopping with my brother. I always feel so pressured to buy crap from American Eagle, just because he works there. And every time I go in there, I always think "Maybe this time, I'll find something." Except for their sweaters, I never do. I hate all that trendy crap. My mom finally just gave me some money and left to drop my brother off at a friend's house... so I had about an hour and a half to look by myself. And then I found a couple things at JC Penney and Sears. Must...have...coffee...

Yesterday is a wrinkle on your forehead
Yesterday is a promise that you've broken
Don't close your eyes, don't close your eyes,
This is your life.
And today is all you've got now.
And today is all you'll ever have.
Don't close your eyes.

This is your life, are you who you want to be?

I just thought this was funny.  So please take no offense.

"Teens drive like complete fools.
 
All these kids see these ricers with a bunch of cosmetic modifications, and of course, they need in. After all, teenagers are the most original and creative sergment of the population. Wow... throw an ugly raingutter on the back of your car and call it a spoiler, add some neon lights and stripes, and guess what? Your car is still a piece of crap."

It was good seeing Michael today. It's been almost seven months I think. I missed him. Not much else went on today, since certain people didn't call me back. They know who they are. *evil eye* I watched One Night In Eden by Sarah Brightman again. I think that's my favorite of her concerts/albums. To tell you the truth, I was rather disappointed with Harem. The songs didn't showcase her true vocal talent. And I didn't like some of the songs, either. Eh. Well.

The weather people said yesterday that today was supposed to be 74 and dry. I wake up this morning, I can barely open my eyes because of the slimy humidity, and I am pissed. What, are these people stupid or something? Does that meteorology degree somehow not enable them to even get the next day's weather right? *wrings the neck of a meteorologist*

For as long as I can remember, I've always had weird dreams. Weird as in disturbing...like, maybe the night was time for my subconscious to unleash everything it represses from day to day. A lot of it scared me, and scares me still. What was I scared of exactly? Maybe I was just afraid to let myself think such things. Inner demons, if you will. Around Christmas, I had night terrors. I would wake up in the middle of the night. My heart would be pounding, I'd be in a cold sweat. But I wouldn't remember a single thing from my dream. Maybe it was so terrible, my subconscious mind wouldn't allow my conscious mind to recall it. *shrugs* I don't think I'll ever figure myself out completely.

I think Chris will be happy to know I finally got around to reading The Hobbit. I really liked it. Hopefully I can read the LOTR trilogy sometime soon. But now I'm reading The Catcher in the Rye, which I heard from numerous people to be a good book. I was reading it on the bus yesterday coming home from work and this guy who was kinda cute said to me "That's a good book. Yeah, I had to read it for school." Too bad he was getting off just then. Hopefully I can meet some interesting people at UWM. There's just no hope at Riverside anymore. I think I've met them all.
You are... 'Damn, I think I might have gone a
little heavy on the eyeliner today.' It's
okay, you're still sexy. You know that, we
know that, everybody knows that. You are
Captain Jack Sparrow, so, of course, everybody
loves you... well... not everybody....
actually, a lot of people don't like you...
but... damn, you sure are sexy. With or
without the eyeliner.

What random made up thought from Pirates of the Caribbean are you?
brought to you by Quizilla
"Fools fear Death, for a fear of Hades."

Aww.  My poor Gumbo is being brushed right now.  She hates it.  So far I have been on summer vacation for over a month.  This is going by way too quickly.  Before I know it, I'll be in school again wishing I could go to work or something instead.  There are things I'm still trying to come to terms with.  And the more I think about them, the harder it becomes.  I want to make you happy.  But in order to do that, I feel as if I'm losing a part of myself.
Some things exist whether you believe in them or not.

Kelly Belly got paid today!  Woo.  Today was pretty slow...not too many people came to swim.  But that was okay because I got to read almost 100 pages in my book.  And, much to my suprise, I saw Nadia!  I stepped out of the basket room to check the status of the toilet paper in the bathroom stalls, when all of a sudden I hear "Kelly!" behind me.  It was Nadia.  Yay yay.  We got to talk for awhile since I didn't have anything to do really.  She's such a great girl.  So funny.

I've been toying with the idea of cutting the back of my hair and leaving the sides and front longer.  If you hve no clue what I'm talking about, I have some pictures I could send you.  I dunno what I want anymore...*sigh*  What do you guys think?

I NEED IT TO RAIN ON LABOR DAY.  Or at least be unseasonably cold.  Just enough of a deterrent so not too many people come to Sheridan.  Do you have any IDEA how AGGRAVATING a thousand whiny, messy brats can be?  Yeah, I had to work July 4th and that's how it was.  And if the weather is the same on Labor Day, it will be just the same or worse.  We had a loud group today, too.  Where do all these kids come from? is what I want to know.  Yet another reason to convince me I shouldn't have kids.
I just wanted to say Happy Belated Birthday to Tami's journal.  Two years!
I just finished reading Brave New World by Aldous Huxley a few days ago. I was a little disappointed in the ending, like I was with 1984. But both are still excellent novels.

I want a new username. I'm tired of 'rustyskillet'. I guess it just sounds too happy. I dunno...sometimes I don't even make sense to myself. I've just been reading through Hayley's journal trying to get caught up on this whole Tami/Rob situation. Being ditched (sometimes) by your best friend because of a significant other is something I have definitely felt before. It's not a good feeling...not a bit...life cannot be fair it seems. But I hope you're feeling better, dear. EDIT: And I'm gonna shut my mouth about the above said. Kelly is neutral. I had to go to Bradford Beach yesterday morning at 7:00 AM to take pictures with all the parkies and lifeguards. It took well over an hour. *rolls eyeballs* I saw a girl I knew in middle school. Apparently she's a lifeguard. We didn't talk, but I think she recognized me. Bad memories...damn preppy clique. I'm so glad she doesn't work at Sheridan. I got to see Karl, too. So it wasn't a total waste of time. I was just kinda peeved that I had to wake up so early. Oh my word...haha...have you ever had the hilarious experience of hearing William Shatner trying to sing? If you guys want to know what I'm talking about, just IM me and I'll send you some MP3s. Ahh...he is horrible.

I started playing my dad's guitar last night because I really want to learn.  So far I've taught myself the first part of the intro to "Falling" (Lacuna Coil).  My finger tips are sore...heh.  But it's all good.  Hopefully I'll stick with this and actually get good.  Hmm.  There's a thought. *grins*

Yesterday after work, I met up with Jess, Dee, Jamie, and Land (somewhat later) at Borders downtown.  We found a cool hippie store just off Wisconsin Ave., called Bead World or something.  Such a great store...too bad they didn't have any hemp jewelry.  But other than that, it was perfect.  I'm going to have to go back there next time I get paid.  I got a Celtic weave necklace and some inscense (Dragon's Blood & Green Tea).  From there we went to the lakefront by the art museum.  The expansion is so lovely...I had a great time, you guys.  I shook out my work shirt this morning (it's a habit) and out rolls a little Buddha guy on my bed.  Um...Jess you forgot to take him back last night.  Heh.  We have to work out a time when I can get that back to you.  He's so cute!  *grins*

You're a great person, Dee.  I'm so glad I got to meet you.

Sometimes...my self-analysis backfires. And I end up in the emotional state that I tried so hard to supress or extinguish altogether. Every time I try not to like someone, I usually do in the end. And it never works out...I end up putting myself through so much crap for nothing. But...it's not too late. Maybe I can still reason myself out of this. these wounds won't seem to heal this pain is just too real there's just too much that time cannot erase
You represent... naivete. So innocent and trusting... you can be very shy at
times, but it's only because you're not sure
how to act. You give off that "I need to
be protected vibe." Remember that not all
people are good. Being too trusting will get
you easily hurt.

What feeling do you represent?
brought to you by Quizilla

It's hot and I'm bothered. *rolls eyeballs* That's so corny but I'm saying it anyway. I can't think up anything layout-related tonight. I want to revamp my personal site (aeuriopa) but I just can't think of anything concrete. Ideas come and go, and nothing seems to stick. And then I still have a ton of stuff to do on my Jeanette site. I think I'll give it a rest for the night. This is too frustrating. Ahh...work was so crazy yesterday. It seemed like the entire city of Cudahay streamed into Sheridan all afternoon. And there were lots of people I wanted to strangle...*clenches fists*...rawr. But that was yesterday. And this is today. Sleep always pacifies me. I had off today...didn't really do much. I went with my parents on various errands. Oh! I got paid the day before yesterday. Woo. So we cashed that today and I was able to get A Hard Day's Night for a good price. Hopefully I can watch that sometime soon. I guess that's all for now...*stretches* I'm going to peel myself out of this chair now and do something else. I dunno what.

[Name] Kelly B. [Birthday] March 4, 1987 [Zodiac sign] Pisces [Sex] Female LAST PERSON WHO... [Slept in your bed] Me [Saw you cry] My cat [Made you cry] The world...I was mad at it once again. [Spent the night at your house] It's been too long to remember. [You shared a drink with] Jess [You went to the movies with] Uhh...my grandparents. [You went to the mall with] My parents. [Yelled at you] My brother (but I yelled back). [Sent you an email] Holly [Said they were going to kill you] Umm...no one that I can recall. HAVE YOU EVER... [Said "I love you" and meant it?] Yes. [Gotten into a fight with your doggy/walrus/bird/fish/etc.] My cat sometimes bites my ankles...if that's what you mean. [Been to New York?] No, not yet. [Been to Florida?] No, and I don't really want to go. [California?] No, not yet. [Hawaii?] No, not yet. [Mexico?] No, and I don't really want to go. [China?] No, not yet. [Canada?] Ah, no, but I want to see their navy. [Danced nekkid?] No... [Dreamed something really crazy and then it happens the next day?] Not yet. [Stalked someone?] No. [Had a mud bath?] No. [Wished you were a guy/girl?] No. [Had an imaginary friend?] In elementary school, but I didn't really believe in it. EITHER OR... [Apples or bananas?] Apples. [Red or blue?] Blue. [Backstreet Boys or N Sync?] *screams and runs away* [WalMart or Target?] Target, man. [Santa or Rudolph?] Rudolph. He's so cute. [Math or English?] English. [High school or college?] College! Most definitely. [What are you going to do after you finish this survey?] Check my email, see if I got anything new from Holly. [What was the last food you ate?] Some noodle dish last night for dinner. [Are you bored?] A bit. [How many buddies are on?] 1 on, 1 away, 1 idle. [Last movie you saw?] State Fair (1945) [Last noise you heard?] The chattering of birds ouside. ABOUT YOUR FRIENDS - WHO... [Laughs the weirdest?] Karl. [Will grow up and be a model?] Ha...well, maybe Gaby. but I don't think she would like doing that. [Going to have the most kids?] Monica, hands down. She is so going to be a mom. [Have you known the longest?] Jess (6th grade). [Is the loudest?] Karl. [Is the quietest?] Me. [Do you have the most classes with?] Uhh...I guess that would be Chris. [Is the weirdest?] Jess, Karl, Land. [Is the funniest?] Land and Karl. [Is the moodiest?] Me...I have more mood swings than a chick on PMS. [Can you tell most of your secrets to?] I usually just keep them to myself. [Do you usually go to about all of your problems?] God. THE LAST FEW QUESTIONS... [Last time you went out of the state] About six months ago. [Lucky number] I don't have one. [Things you like in a girl/guy?] Christian, dorky, has to make me laugh, sensitive, uses occasional cuss words (stress occasional), intelligent. [Weirdest thing about you?] I'll get back to you on that. [Do you have a crush on someone?] Josh Groban! *grins* [Do they know?] Ha, not unless he somehow reads my LJ. [Do you have a boyfriend/girlfriend?] No. [What's his/her name?] N/A [What do you think of ouija boards?] Scam, dealing with the devil. [What book are you reading now?] Lucy's Bones, Sacred Stones, and Einstein's Brain, the Bible. [What's on your mouse pad?] Umm...my mouse? [Favourite board game?] Monopoly and Life...any game where I can make the other people bankrupt. [Favourite magazine?] Architectural Digest. [Favourite sound?] Music. [Worst feeling in the world?] Feeling as though no one cares. [What is the first thing you think when you wake in the morning?] "Oh..." and then I roll over. [Do you like scary or exciting rollercoasters] Yes! [How many rings before you answer?] One or more. [Future daughter's name?] Willa, Jade, or some other unique name. [Future son's name?] William, Benjamin, Joshua...*shrugs* [Chocolate or vanilla?] It depends on my mood. [Do you sleep with a stuffed animal?] Not since I was 10 maybe. [If you could have any job you wanted, what would it be?] Web designer, historian, appraiser for Christie's or Sotheby's [What is your favourite snapple?] I don't usually drink Snapple. [Are you a lefty, righty or ambidextrous?] Lefty, sometimes ambidextrous. [Do you type with your fingers on the right keys?] I dunno. [What's under your bed?] A whole lot of posters and boxes. [Favourite sport to watch] I hate televised sports. [Did you have fun doing this] It was okay. I have nothing better to do. [ 10 Bands/Artists you've seen live ] 1. Skillet 2. The Benjamin Gate 3. Newsboys 4. dc Talk 5. Audio Adrenaline 6. 38th Parallel 7. Pete Stewart (rockin', man) 8. LaRue 9. Kevin Max 10. Tait [ 9 Things you're looking forward to ] 1. Getting my pay check. 2. Putting more content up on my site. 3. Eating breakfast. 4. Getting/reading more books. 5. Going to college. 6. The day when I can actually meet Holly (internet buddy for 4 years). 7. Living the life God wants me to live. 8. Learning to play guitar. 9. Getting married. [08 Things You Wear Daily] 1. Shirt 2. Pants/shorts 3. Shoes 4. Socks 5. My watch 6. Bobby pins 7. Wallet 8. Hemp necklace [7 Things That Piss You Off] 1. Being lied to. 2. Not knowing stuff. 3. Stupid people. 4. Ebonics (it's not "culture"...it's just lazy English) 5. Extreme liberals. 6. People that try to take advantage of me. 7. eBay sellers that only take PayPal. [06 Things You Touch Every Day] 1. My bed. 2. My hair. 3. My CDs. 4. The fridge. 5. My computer. 6. My cat. [05 Things You Do Every Day] 1. Wake up. 2. Log on AIM. 3. Listen to music. 4. Aimlessly surf the web. 5. Pet my cat. [04 People You'd Want to Spend More Time or Hang out With] 1. Jess 2. Chris 3. Karl 4. Land [03 Movies You Could Watch Over and Over] 1. The Matrix 2. Tess of the D'Urbervilles 3. The Ten Commandments [02 Of Your Favorite Songs At This Moment] 1. The Benjamin Gate - "Need" 2. Grammatrain - "For Me" [01 Person You Could Spend the Rest of Your Life With] 1. Have not met this person yet. Future [do you want to get married] Yes. [if so, what age would you like to be married] Early twenties. [who will you marry] The guy most perfectly suited to me. [what do you want to do when you grow up] Web designer, appraiser for Christie's or Sotheby's, Historian [where will you live] I want to live in Madion. Favorites [food] Egg rolls. [movie] Any of the above three. [tv show] Alias, Gilmore Girls, Smallville, The Simpsons. [beverage] Pepsi Twist, Chai Tea [alcoholic beverage] *gags* [subject] European History [teacher] Ms. Fleet [radio station] Um...none of them are good enough to be called "favorite". [book] Quo Vadis [holiday] Christmas [sport] Soccer, tennis [fast food] McDonald's I guess [color to wear] Black, blue, white, gray [number] 4 [place to eat] Where there is good food. [ice cream flavor] Any coffee-flavored Other questions [do you drink] No. [do you smoke] No. [do you consider yourself attractive] On certain days maybe. [do you consider yourself a nice girl/boy] Yes. [do you have a CD burner] Unfortunately, no. The last [thing you ate] Dinner last night (a noodle dish). [thing you drank] Milk. [song you heard] Umm...I think it was "Comalies" by Lacuna Coil. [show you watched] Gilmore Girls. [thing you said] "Okay mom..." (about locking the door when she left for work) [person you saw] My mom. [person who called you] It's been awhile. [person you called] Jess. [person you hugged] Karl (on the last day of school). [last car you rode in] The family car.

Karl called me after I got home from work.  It was so good to hear from him...heh, that boy can always make me laugh.  As Jess said, our "group" should hang out sometime soon.  Woo...crazy times, man.  Ha.

My report card was fine. I got A's on all my exams except for French and English, which I got B's on.  My final cumulative for the second semester is 3.893.  Yay.  Go me.  Ah crap...Katherine Hepburn died today at age 96.  I guess I sorta expected it at any time since she was so old.  Farewell, Eleanor of Aquitaine.

Ah me...what have I been feeling lately?  Not much of anything.  I was thinking this afternoon what I would be doing exactly ten years from that time, at that exact moment.  Would I still be alive?  Would I be married?  Would I be anything like I am right now?  I guess I was mostly thinking about if I would still be alone.  There are some days when it hurts so much, not to be able to have someone I can share my life with.  There are some days when I beg God to let me have someone...I turn a tear-streaked face towards the sky in a desperate effort to see something of the heavenlies.  But I think God wants me to me happy with myself first, happy with Him within me, before He'll allow someone else to be within me as well.  Maybe I'm talking nonsense to you here, but it's starting to become clearer to me every day.  But it's hard...so hard...  So hard to let Peace overtake me.  I've had offers in the past...but I never felt right about it.  There was always that lingering doubt.  Was I scared?  Yes.  But in the end, it will all be okay.  In the end...I can rest easy.

And all my dreams It's never quite as it seems I added him to my buddy list again. I took him off for some months while I gathered myself together. Gathered myself together into who I am. Strength bursting forth, life emerging from the river of existence. I can stand on my own...no twisting, writhing contractions in my stomach. And you know what? I feel great. My hair...gah. This growing out thing is progressing slowly. I took a shower and didn't put anything in it, just blow dried it. It looks kinda shaggy / messy...you know, I think I like it. *shrugs*

Work went pretty well today.  Not many people came since the weather was a bit cool, so that allowed me to sit back most of the afternoon and read.  Woo.  Some moron stole the stamper that we use for people wanting to leave and come back again.  We're thinking the kid will probably show up tomorrow trying to get in with his hand stamped...MY GOSH what an idiot.  Stupid people do stupid things. *shakes head*

Happy Deathday!

Kinda cynical right now...*rolls eyeballs*  It seems like all people do is gush and gush and gush over stupid crap that could be avoided so easily.  Relationships require commitment.  Situations require decisions.  Come on people, this is nothing new.  My word.

I've been reading up on sunburn a bit and I learned that the swelling reaches its peak at 24 hours (which has already passed) and improves within 48 (which I can start to feel now). Thank God. I've never had sunburn that got swollen before. Eh, there's always a first time for everything. Work was fine...I handled the baskets (i.e. sat there most of the day since not many people came, and since still fewer bought baskets for storage). Heh. But that's just fine...I wasn't feeling up to doing anything strenuous. I have off on Monday! So...if anyone wants to do something, just give me a call. I went to Half-Price Books this morning and I got a copy of Ben-Hur (which I have wanted to read for a long time) and a copy of Jude the Obscure (which I have also wanted to read). Nifty. I guess that's all for now...au revior kiddies.
Sunburn is an occupational hazard.  My legs...*cries*...walking requires effort.
